findings.name: Cross Site Scripting (Reflected)
findings.description: Cross-site Scripting (XSS) is an attack technique that involves echoing attacker-supplied code into a user's browser instance.
findings.solution: Validate all input and encode output. Use Content-Security-Policy header.

findings.name: SQL Injection
findings.description: SQL injection may be possible. The page results were successfully manipulated using the boolean conditions.
findings.solution: Use parameterized queries. Validate and sanitize all user input.

findings.name: X-Frame-Options Header Not Set
findings.description: X-Frame-Options header is not included in the HTTP response to protect against 'ClickJacking' attacks.
findings.solution: Set X-Frame-Options header to DENY or SAMEORIGIN.

findings.name: X-Content-Type-Options Header Missing
findings.description: The Anti-MIME-Sniffing header X-Content-Type-Options was not set to 'nosniff'.

findings.name: CRLF Injection
findings.description: HTTP response splitting may be possible via CRLF injection.
findings.solution: Validate and sanitize all user input. Remove CR and LF characters.
